cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 510 miles southeast of New Orleans, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest across the east-central Gulf of Mexico, then curving north toward the southeast/central Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana near Intracoastal City–Morgan City area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Sabine Pass, TX to Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge, LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: None for Texas coast; Hurricane and Tropical-Storm Warnings confined to Louisiana–Mississippi coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from eastern Texas through Louisiana, Mississippi, and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Sustained 25–35 mph with gusts to 40 mph possible late Sunday into early Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible near Sabine Pass/Port Arthur during peak onshore flow Sunday night–Monday
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain, locally higher in squalls, mainly late Sunday–Monday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and minor coastal flooding in the lower Sabine–Neches estuary
